content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

To define a `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct in Julia, you can use the following code:
```
function Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, x.value, " ", x.unit)
end
```
This will define a method for the `Base.show` function that takes an I/O stream and a `FloatWithUnits` object as arguments. The method will print the value of the `FloatWithUnits` object followed by a space and then the unit.

For example, if you create a `FloatWithUnits` object with the value 1.8 and the unit "meters", the `show` method will print "1.8 meters".
```
julia> x = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
1.8 meters
```
